diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute appendicitis with perforation and localized peritonitis, without abscess
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute diffuse abdominal pain that localized to the right lower quadrant, along with symptoms of nausea, emesis, anorexia, and fever. CT imaging revealed an enlarged appendix with mucosal hyperemia, substantial surrounding inflammatory changes, and small volume free fluid, indicating perforation and localized peritonitis.
